intro: Justicia pinguior, commonly known as the woolly justicia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
